Title: N210 trillion audit gap: I needed time to get it right, NNPC boss tells Senate
Summary: In what could be one of the most consequential oversight hearings in recent history, the Senate, yesterday, demanded from the Nigerian government . NNPC boss tells the Senate that he needed time to get it right .

Title: 2027: Lukman alleges ADC leaders’ move to impose candidates
Summary: Leading member of the opposition African Democratic Congress (ADC), Salihu Lukman, has alleged that the top echelon of the party was trying to impose candidates .

Title: Current security architecture can’t contain insecurity, Alia says
Summary: Governor Hyacinth Alia of Benue State has stated that the country’s current security architecture is inadequate to curtail the pervasive insecurity . Alia: Current security architecture can’t contain insecurity, Alia says .

Title: Nigeria’s economy to grow by  3.4 per cent this year, IMF affirms
Summary: Nigeria’s economy is expected to grow by 3.4 per cent this year but slow to 3.2 per cent next year . The International Monetary Fund (IMF) affirms that the country's economy will grow by three per cent .

Title: Group urges S’East govs on security, probe into Imo community killings
Summary: The World Igbo National Union (WINU) condemned the recent brutal killings of Igbo at Umualaoma, Arondizuogu in Ideato North Local Government . The group urges S’East govs on security, probe into Imo community killings .

Title: Transcorp Group records 21% in profit to N85.7bn in H1’25
Summary: Transnational Corporation Plc (Transcorp Group) recorded a 21 per cent increase in Profit Before tax, PBT, to N85.7 billion in the first half of 2025, H1’25 . Increase in profitability was driven by a 59 per cent growth in revenue .

Title: MAN expresses concern over industrial sector decline in GDP
Summary: Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN) expressed concerns over declining share of industrial sector in GDP . The Association called on the federal government to prioritise manufacturing and industrialisation to boost the real economic situation .

Title: IMF upgrades Nigeria’s economic growth forecast  to 3.4%
Summary: IMF upgraded its forecast for Nigeria’s economic growth to 3.4 per cent in 2025 . The new forecast represents 0.4 percentage points from the 3.0 per cent forecast of the IMF in April this year . IMF raised the forecast for the country's economic growth for 2026 .

Title: Tesla, Samsung seal $16.5b AI chip alliance
Summary: Tesla has entered into a $16.5 billion partnership with Samsung to produce advanced AI chips . The move is poised to shape the future of artificial intelligence, AI, and electric vehicles .

Title: Who are the bigots? by Rotimi Fasan
Summary: Some people have made it a habit to consistently challenge the authority of state officials to act in a manner consistent with the execution of their duties . That should be seen as an invitation to chaos and boldly challenged....

Title: Poor police pension killing morale in service – IG
Summary: The Inspector-General of Police, Kayode Egbetokun, has raised concerns over the plight of retired officers under the Contributory Pension Scheme . He said the hardship has instilled fear and anxiety among serving officers, weakening morale across the ranks . He stated this during a meeting with senior police officers in Abuja .

Summary: The Independent Corrupt Practices and Other Related Offences Commission has lamented lack of official eagerness to wage war against corruption . It said about 92 Ministries, Departments, and Agencies are yet to establish anti-corruption units . Title: FG vows to end era of strikes in tertiary institutions
Summary: The Minister of Education, Tunji Alausa, says the Federal Government is committed to ending the era of strikes in Nigeria’s tertiary institutions . He promised improved engagement and fulfilment of agreements with academic unions . President Bola Tinubu had issued a firm directive to prevent further disruptions in tertiary education .
